headline: Science Weekly podcast: The joy of science demonstrations
text: In this special edition, Alok Jha presents the show live from the Faraday Theatre at the Royal Institution in London. In front of a boisterous audience of science fans, guests present science demonstrations and discuss the importance of the demo in enabling us to grasp profound scientific truths.  Demonstrators include science writer and broadcaster Adam Rutherford, Wellcome Trust Engagement Fellow and anaesthetist Kevin Fong, Professor Frank James from the Royal Institution, Dr Gail Cardew director of science and education at the institution, science teacher and demo expert Alom Shaha, and Anna Starkey, creator of Impossible Projects at Lotto Lab at the Science Museum.
